column4: why are you asking on #ubuntu? read some kernel books and goto #linux-kernel
because my first question was "how much ram I need to make my swap clean"
and because I ask in "ubuntu desktop" context
a gig
_minimum_
my system is up for about 10 days
just get 512
it's not for me - 256 should be enough
256 is barely enough
after browsing with firefox for a while, they'll be swapping hard
I got 768 on my system and it works really nice
what is SPE and evince?
I think that this SPE is broken or something
even Eclipse doesn't use that much ram
-/+ buffers/cache:     243720     402420
SPE is using only 63.3 meg. now that's not bad at all for a pretty feature-filled python IDE
with amule, xchat, gnome-system-monitor, firefox and eclipse
some applets, and firestarter and apache2
there is something wrong with your system - maybe wrong/broken kernel?
my gnome-panel 29MB
just stock warty kernel. there is nothing wrong with my system. gnome and company is greedy
are you sure that you got kernel optimized for your cpu?
